data.title: After a three-month hiatus, a whale withdrew 9,000 ETH from Bitget, worth $34.66 million.
data.description: Onchain Lens monitoring shows that a whale withdrew 9,000 ETH, worth $34.66 million, from Bitget after a three-month period of inactivity. This whale also has 15,127 ETH, worth $58.4 million, staked on Lido.

data.title: Arc releases list of the first 11 projects built on its public testnet.
data.description: Circle L1 blockchain Arc has released its initial list of 11 projects building on its public testnet. These include ZKP2P (an on-chain stablecoin protocol), Sequence (a general-purpose crypto trading platform), Superface (a smart agent solution interconnection platform), Blockradar (a stablecoin wallet infrastructure), Copperx (a stablecoin banking service), Crossmint (a crypto API development company), Hurupay (a cross-border fund transfer and management program), Para (a wallet infrastructure), CFi (a personalized finance platform), Hinkal (a zero-knowledge proof-based wallet), and Axelar Network (a cross-chain infrastructure).

data.title: Coinbase CEO: Bullish on BTC, company will continue to increase holdings.
data.description: Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong posted on the X platform that Coinbase is bullish on Bitcoin, with the company increasing its Bitcoin holdings by 2,772 in the third quarter and continuing to increase its Bitcoin holdings.

data.title: BitMEX launches ZEC and XMR contract trading, supporting leverage up to 33x.
data.description: BitMEX announced the launch of Zcash (ZEC) and Moreno (XMR) contract trading, supporting leverage up to 33x.

data.title: Binance will adjust the cross-margin collateral ratio on November 7th and 14th.
data.description: According to an official announcement, Binance will adjust the collateral ratios for multiple assets under its cross-margin leverage model in two batches, at 06:00 (UTC) on November 7, 2025 and 06:00 (UTC) on November 14, 2025. This involves dozens of tokens including WIF, JTO, OP, VET, and NEIRO. The adjustment is expected to last approximately 30 minutes. Users should closely monitor their margin levels to avoid potential liquidation risks. (This news item was generated with AI assistance.)

data.title: Strategy Transfers Significant Bitcoin Holdings to New Wallets
data.description: According to PANews, monitoring by Lookonchain has revealed that Strategy has transferred 22,704 BTC, valued at $2.45 billion, to several new wallets over the past nine hours.

data.title: Polymarket predicts an 89% probability that "the US version of Polymarket will launch in 2025".
data.description: Data from the Polymarket platform shows that the probability of predicting "Polymarket's US version will launch in 2025" has reached 89%, with the total prize pool currently exceeding $5.53 million. Previously, influenced by news of "Polymarket's $112 million acquisition of the compliant US exchange QCX," the probability of this bet rose to 98.8% before falling back to a low of 78.8%. According to TheBlock, Polymarket will return to the US by the end of November, after which it will launch and airdrop the POLY token.

data.title: ZEC briefly broke through 380 USDT, continuing to reach new highs.
data.description: Market data shows that ZEC briefly broke through 380 USDT, continuing to reach new highs, and is currently trading at 377.9 USDT, with a 24-hour increase of 11%.

data.title: Cryptography's Role in Data Security Discussed by Experts
data.description:
According to Foresight News, Professor Ian Miers, an expert in security and applied cryptography, recently shared insights on Twitter regarding the role of cryptography in data security. Miers emphasized that cryptography is a subset of the security field rather than a theoretical branch. He cautioned against the centralized storage of highly sensitive data, even when using advanced cryptographic techniques like MPC (Multi-Party Computation) or FHE (Fully Homomorphic Encryption), citing examples such as global AML (Anti-Money Laundering) KYC (Know Your Customer) processes or content moderation strategies.

Vitalik Buterin, a prominent figure in the cryptocurrency community, responded to Miers' comments by highlighting that content itself is often in plaintext. He suggested that anonymous posting combined with blocking features could be achieved through ZK (Zero-Knowledge) proofs, and AI-driven content moderation could utilize ZK proof algorithms with delayed publication.

In the context of encrypted message content moderation, such as chat control, Miers pointed out that neither TEE (Trusted Execution Environment) nor cryptography can securely handle servers viewing all messages. Buterin agreed with this assessment and proposed that client-side scanning could be a compliant method. He suggested that users could opt for local AI maintained by different organizations or choose to disable it entirely, eliminating the need for complex cryptographic solutions.

data.title: Ethereum Sets December Date for Game-Changing Fusaka Upgrade
data.description:
Ethereum will activate its Fusaka upgrade on December 3, adding PeerDAS, higher gas limits, and doubled blob capacity to boost scalability and efficiency.

The post Ethereum Sets December Date for Game-Changing Fusaka Upgrade first appeared on Ecoinimist.

source: https://ecoinimist.com/2025/10/31/ethereum-sets-december-fusaka-launch/?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=ethereum-sets-december-fusaka-launch

data.title: Bitcoin Whale Deposits Significant Amount to Centralized Exchange
data.description: According to BlockBeats On-chain Detection, a prominent Bitcoin whale has deposited 200 Bitcoins, valued at approximately $21.94 million, into a centralized exchange. Over the past three weeks, this whale has transferred a total of 6,003 Bitcoins to the platform, amounting to roughly $672 million.

data.description:

data.title: Analysts: Strategy tested nine new addresses, suspected to be related to a change in hosting provider.
data.description: Analyst Emmett Gallic noted that Strategy tested nine new addresses (excluding change addresses), which appears to be related to a change in custodian. ScriptHash addresses (starting with 3) are the same type as Coinbase Prime deposit addresses, but funds were not aggregated in this test, hence this discrepancy.

data.title: The Ether.Fi community has proposed allocating up to $50 million of its treasury funds for token buybacks.
data.description: The Ether.Fi community has proposed allocating treasury funds for an ETHFI buyback program, authorizing the foundation to use treasury funds to buy back ETHFI tokens when the market price falls below $3, with a maximum buyback amount of $50 million. The goal is to continuously accumulate ETHFI while the price remains below this threshold and increase the proportion of protocol revenue used for buybacks. The buyback will begin immediately upon DAO approval and continue until one of the following occurs: the maximum amount is reached; the foundation deems the program complete; or a subsequent governance vote modifies or terminates the program. The next step will be a four-day vote on Snapshot. Once approved, the buyback program will take effect immediately upon meeting certain price conditions.
